attributes.trait_type: ground meat (beef, lamb, pork, or chicken)

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the cabbage and boil for 3-5 minutes until the outer leaves soften.
Remove softened leaves carefully and repeat until all usable leaves are removed.
Trim the thick stalks from the leaves without cutting into the leaf itself.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat and sauté the chopped onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened (about 5 minutes). Let cool.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked rice, ground meat, egg, and sautéed vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a large spoonful (about 1/2 cup) of the meat mixture on the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold in the sides and roll up tightly.

Cook the Rolls:

In a large pot, layer the bottom with chopped cabbage and carrots.
Place the cabbage rolls seam-side down in a single layer, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and add another layer if necessary.
In a bowl, mix the tomato sauce, stock, and bay leaves, and pour over the rolls.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 1 hour.

Serve:

Remove the cooked rolls from the pot.
Stir the sour cream into the remaining sauce in the pot.
Serve the cabbage rolls hot, topped with the sour cream sauce and additional sour cream if desired.
